name: Color Filler Remastered
description:
Color Filler Remastered

Color Filler is a simple yet difficult grid-based puzzle game, where you try to fill in all the colored holes.

The first game-jam i ever participated in, was the first I Can't Draw But Want To Make A Game game-jam.
So when i saw that Charlmes was hosting a sequel, i had to join.
And i really glad i did!

I decided to remake/finish, the game i made for the first game-jam (Color Filler), as i really liked the concept, but didn't feel like it was polished or finished.

What i did/changed:
  • I completely redid the code

    I used most of the first week completely redoing the code, as the old code was horrible, and there were so many bugs and glitches, that made the game somewhat unplayable.
    I also added move queuing, as it was sorely needed, and it helped give the game a better user experience.
    Oh, and I added a new block, the Mover! It should help make the later levels more complex.

  • I made a new sprite-sheet

    I remade all of the sprites. I'm not sure the new sprite are better, but i felt that they had to be different from the old sprites.
    So this time, the sprites are 32x32 instead of 16x16, so they have a little more detail.
    I also added small dots to each of the colored blocks, so colorblind players can also play the game.

  • I added 25 levels

    I added 25 new levels, so there in total are 45 levels.
    Most of the new levels are a lot harder than the old, so now it is a bigger challenge to complete the whole game.
    I really wanted there to be 50 levels, but unfortunately i didn't have time for the last 5...

  • I made a new menu

    I made a whole new menu, as the old one was confusing and players had a hard time figuring out how to start a new game.
    So I stuck with a basic menu with buttons.

  • I made a new song

    I used the last few days of the jam to make another song, so now there are 2 songs.
    I really wanted there to be even more songs, but like with the last 5 levels, I didn't have time for it.

I hope you injoy the game!
Thank you for playing!
